meanings.definition: To mark or designate with a stake.
meanings.sent1: She staked the area for the new garden with wooden stakes.
meanings.sent2: The farmer staked the boundaries of his land with bright flags.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel staked out its territory with tiny acorns.
meanings.sent4: The explorer staked his claim on the uncharted island with a flag.
meanings.sent5: The detective staked the crime scene with caution tape.

meanings.definition: To support or secure with a stake.
meanings.sent1: He staked the young tree to help it grow straight and tall.
meanings.sent2: The tent was staked firmly to the ground to withstand the wind.
meanings.sent3: The superhero staked the villain to the ground with a giant stake.
meanings.sent4: She staked her hopes on the success of the project.
meanings.sent5: The gardener staked the fragile plant to prevent it from bending.

meanings.definition: To gamble or risk money or something of value on an outcome.
meanings.sent1: He staked his savings on the horse race, hoping for a win.
meanings.sent2: The gambler staked all his chips on the final hand.
meanings.sent3: She staked her reputation on the success of the event.
meanings.sent4: The entrepreneur staked everything on the new business venture.
meanings.sent5: The student staked his future on passing the exam.
